Extensions

Originally, GeMM was designed to model island plant communities, but it has since been adapted to various other study questions. These files include functions that are not needed by the "core" model, but were added for these other studies.

habitatchange.jl

Investigate the effect of temporal habitat change on plant communities.

GeMM.changehabitat! — Method
changehabitat!(world)

Carry out 'global change' on all patches.

source
GeMM.changeprec! — Method
changeprec!(world, sdprec)

Change the precipitation of all patches according to a normal distribution.

source
GeMM.changetemp! — Method
changetemp!(world, sdtemp)

Change the temperature of all patches according to a normal distribution.

source
GeMM.markthem! — Method
markthem!(community)

Set each individual in the community (= array of individuals) as "marked".

source
GeMM.markthem! — Method
markthem!(world)

Set every individual in the world as "marked".

source
GeMM.markthem! — Method
markthem!(habitat)

Set each individual in the given patch as "marked".

source

invasion.jl

Carry out species invasions experiments in an island setting.

FIXME Documenter.jl doesn't recognise function definitions that are not on the top level - like the invade!() functions.

GeMM.disturb! — Method
disturb!(world)

Disturb all patches in the world.

source
GeMM.disturb! — Method
disturb!(patch, intensity)

Species-independent mortality due to disturbance on the given patch. The intensity gives the mortality percentage.

source

zosterops.jl

Adapt GeMM to investigate eco-evolutionary population dynamics of East-African Zosterops populations in the Taita Hills, Kenya.

FIXME Documenter.jl doesn't recognise function definitions that are not on the top level. This includes:

  • initzosteropsspecies()
  • getzosteropsspecies()
  • coordinate()
GeMM.findneighbours! — Method
findneighbours(world)

Construct a list of neighbours for each patch in the world, for faster lookup later on. (Must be called during initialisation.)

source
GeMM.zdisperse! — Method
zdisperse!(world)

Disperse all juvenile individuals within the world.

source
GeMM.zdisperse! — Method
zdisperse!(bird, patch, world)

Dispersal of a single bird. Birds look patches with a suitable habitat and a free territory or available mate. (Cf. Aben et al. 2016)

source
GeMM.zfindmate — Method
zfindmate(population, bird)

Find an available breeding partner in the given population, preferring conspecifics. Returns the partner individual, or nothing.

source
GeMM.zgenesis — Method
zgenesis(patch)

Create a new community of Zosterops breeding pairs (possibly of multiple species). Returns an array of individuals.

source
GeMM.ziscompatible — Method
ziscompatible(individual1, individual2)

Check to see whether two birds are reproductively compatible.

source
GeMM.zreproduce! — Method
zreproduce!(patch)

Reproduction of Zosterops breeding pairs in a patch.

source
